revised_title: Cerebral Cortex Physiology in Higher Apes: Observations and Topographical Distribution
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the cerebral cortex of higher apes, specifically orangutans, gorillas, and chimpanzees, to study the topographical distribution of functions in the anthropoid brain. They discovered the "motor" area's location and extent, as well as the representation of various body regions' musculature in the brain. The study also discussed the effects of ablations in the precentral and post-central gyri on movement and paresis.
